<!-- Add a search input with placeholder -->
 <select:Select liveSearch="true" liveSearchPlaceholder="Please type something...">
 \s\s<select:Option text="..."/>
 \s\s...

 <!-- Add key words to options to improve their searchability -->
 <select:Select liveSearch="true" liveSearchPlaceholder="ketchup, mustard, frosting...">
 \s\s<select:Option tokens="ketchup mustard" text="Hot Dog, Fries and a Soda"/>
 \s\s<select:Option tokens="mustard" text="Burger, Shake and a Smile"/>

<!-- Set the title attribute on individual options to display alternative text when the option is selected -->
 <select:Select>
 \s\s<select:Option text="Hot Dog, Fries and a Soda" title="Combo 1"/>
 \s\s<select:Option text="Burger, Shake and a Smile" title="Combo 2"/>
 \s\s<select:Option text="Sugar, Spice and all things nice" title="Combo 3"/>
 </select:Select>

 <!-- It also works for multiple select boxes -->
 <select:MultipleSelect>
 \s\s<select:Option text="Hot Dog, Fries and a Soda" title="Combo 1"/>
 \s\s<select:Option text="Burger, Shake and a Smile" title="Combo 2"/>
 \s\s<select:Option text="Sugar, Spice and all things nice" title="Combo 3"/>
 </select:MultipleSelect>

<!-- VALUES: A comma delimited list of selected values (default) -->
 <!-- COUNT: If one item is selected, then the value is shown, if more than one is selected then the number of selected
 \s\sitems is displayed, eg 2 of 6 selected -->
 <!-- STATIC: Always show the select title (placeholder), regardless of selection -->
 <select:MultipleSelect selectedTextFormat="VALUES | COUNT | STATIC">
 \s\s<select:Option text="..."/>
 \s\s...
 </select:MultipleSelect>

 <!-- COUNT > X: Where X is the number of items selected when the display format changes from values to count -->
 <select:MultipleSelect countSelectedTextFormat="2">
 \s\s<select:Option text="..."/>
 \s\s<select:Option text="..."/>
 \s\s...
 </select:MultipleSelect>
